headline: How NYSE’s New MSCI Options Listing Role Could Impact Intercontinental Exchange (ICE) Investors
summary: In early January 2026, the New York Stock Exchange, part of Intercontinental Exchange, announced an agreement for NYSE Arca and NYSE American to become the U.S. options listing venues for benchmark MSCI indexes, including MSCI Emerging Markets, EAFE, ACWI, World, and USA, pending regulatory approval. This development extends ICE’s long-running derivatives collaboration with MSCI, building on its position as the primary global venue for trading MSCI futures and its large daily notional MSCI...
